alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 5:46AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Maryland, including the following county: St. Marys. * WHEN...Until 1145 AM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 544 AM EDT, St. Mary`s River at Great Mills has entered Minor Flood stage in response to heavy rainfall last night. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lexington Park... Leonardtown... Piney Point... Tall Timbers... Saint Marys River... Saint Marys City... Town Creek... White Point Beach... Greenwell State Park... Saint Inigoes Creek... Saint Clements Bay... California... Patuxent River Naval Air Station...Hollywood... Great Mills... Callaway... Valley Lee... Drayden... Park Hall... Redgate... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
